Content.Title: After Fall 2011
Content.Abstract: Associate of Science in Nursing traditonal track After Fall 2011
Content.BodyCopy:
ASN Sample Academic Plan- begins Fall 2011

ESL STUDENTS must submit TOEFL scores. See Catalog for details.

For students beginning the Nursing Program Fall 2011 or later

Sample Academic Plan PDF file for Traditional track

PREREQUISITE YEAR
BYU-I Semester 1: (may Apply to the Program) Cr BYU-I Semester 2: (application reviewed by selections council) Cr
BIO 264 (program pre-requisite)
4 BIO 265 (program pre-requisite) 4
Group 1: required
3 Group 2: required 4
Total Semester Credits 15 Total Semester Credits 12
FRESHMAN NURSING YEAR
NURSING: 1st Semester: (If admitted, begin nursing program) Cr NURSING 2nd Semester: Cr
NURS 100 6 NURS 122 5
NURS 110 1 NURS 123 2
BIO221 3
Total Semester Credits 10 Total Semester Credits 7
SOPHOMORE NURSING YEAR
NURSING 3rd Semester: Cr NURSING 4th Semester: Block 1 Cr
NURS 230 6 NURS 222 6
NURS 236 1 NURS 225 1
Total Semester Credits 7 Total Semester Credits 7
Foundations Credits:
27 TOTAL ASN PROGRAM CREDITS 73
Group 1: (3 cr. Req.) Group 2: (4 cr. Req.) FOUNDATIONS GATEWAY:
Psych 111 (3) Chem 101* (4) FDMAT 108 (3)
SOC111** (3) Micro Lab BIO 222 (1) FDENG 101 (3)
Medical Terminology HS 280 (2) Nutrition HFED 100(3) FDSCI 101 (2)
Child 210 (3) Pharmacology BIO 386 (3) FDAMF 101 (3)
Physics PH 101 (4)

Students are NOT required to complete all requirements before beginning the Nursing Program

Students MUST complete three credits from the Group 1 list and four credits from Group 2 list. More may be taken. These courses are all strongly recommended.

ALL Program Requirements must be completed by the end of the 4th nursing semester

*Chemistry 101 is a prerequisite for Pathophysiology (Required for the BYU-I BSN). All students planning on completing a BSN (whether at BYU-Idaho or elsewhere) are advised that Chemistry will be required. Taking CHEM 101during the ASN is strongly encouraged.

**Sociology is required in California for Licensure. Other states may have similar requirements for Sociology or other academic requirements. The State Board of Nursing in your state should be able to help you.

Also suggested:
FDMATH 222 Bio STATS: important for those graduate school bound
BIO 381 Pathophysiology: required for the RN to BSN program
FDCNC 250 Foundations Capstone: Required for RN to BSN

Alternate Students must also complete all University Foundations and Religion Requirements.
FDENG 101 (3)
FDREL 121 (2)
FDENG 201 (3)
FDREL 122 (2)
FDAMF 101 (3)
FDREL 200 (2)
FDHUM (3)
Scripture Base Class (2)
FDINT (2)
FDSCI 101 (3)
FDMAT 108 (3)

Revised: 17 May 2012
